caption.title: Sensitivity analysis on mosquito lifespan.
caption.p: A Estimated mean final epidemic size as a function of k and R index. Vertical dashed line corresponds to the mean value of k obtained by analyzing NHAPS data [ 14] (NHAPS), Miami-Dade County residents data for weekdays (M-D Wd), and Miami-Dade County residents data for weekends (M-D We). Model parameters are assumed at their baseline value as reported in Fig 1B, but for mean mosquito lifespan that is assumed 8.5 days B As A, but assuming mean mosquito lifespan equal to 12 days. C As A, but for the outbreak probability. We define “outbreak” an epidemic of at least 100 cases. D As C, but assuming mean mosquito lifespan equal to 12 days. E, As A, but for the peak time. (Note that the scale is different from that of Fig 3C). F, As E, but assuming mean mosquito lifespan equal to 12 days.
Click here for additional data file.
